response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("Age", "medium", "Being a young adult (21 years old) is associated with higher risk of recidivism due to brain development and life experience."),
    ("Gender", "low", "Gender alone does not significantly predict recidivism, but males tend to have slightly higher rates than females."),
    ("Ethnicity", "medium", "Black individuals may face systemic disadvantages that could contribute to higher recidivism rates."),
    ("Arrests and Convictions", "high", "A history of multiple arrests and convictions is a strong predictor of future criminal behavior."),
    ("Marital Status", "low", "Marital status does not significantly predict recidivism in this context."),
    ("Employment History", "medium", "Limited employment history can indicate instability, which may increase the risk of recidivism."),
    ("Education Level", "high", "Lack of a high school diploma or GED is associated with higher rates of recidivism due to limited job opportunities and skills."),
    ("Drug Use", "medium", "Past drug use, especially marijuana, can be indicative of ongoing substance abuse issues that may contribute to criminal behavior."),
    ("Mental Health", "high", "Persistent feelings of sadness or depression could indicate underlying mental health issues that might increase the risk of recidivism if not properly addressed."),
    ("Family Background", "medium", "Growing up in a single-parent household and urban area can be associated with higher risk due to potential socioeconomic disadvantages."),
    ("Religious Beliefs", "low", "Personal religious beliefs do not significantly predict recidivism rates.")
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 75
}

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 21-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 4 times and has been convicted. He is 6 feet 1 inch and weighs 165 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He does not have a high school diploma or GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held 1 job during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 5, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
